trial_identification.studytitle: External cues (audiovisual) for the regulation of gait in Parkinson's disease
trial_identification.scientifictitle: External cues (audiovisual) for the regulation of gait in Parkinson's disease

interventions.interventions: This study used a reversal design (A-B-A). Participantis are assessed for 5 weeks prior to the intervention to establish a baseline level of behaviour (A). The intervention program is then administered for 5 weeks (B). On completion of the program, the same parameters are assessed for 5 weeks without intervention (A). During the intervention the participant walked while he was submitted to visual (laser pointer fixed in the subject thorax projecting a mark in the ground) and auditory (metronome) stimulations simultaneously. Duration fo sessions: 30 minutes. Frequency of sessions: three times per week. Mode of administration of the intervention: sessions administered/supervised by physical educator.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Effects of a gait training program on gait motor variables (cadence, speed, stride length and stride time) assessed with video analysis and reflective markers.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Parkinson's disease patient, able to walk 5 minutes continually.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This single case study (reversal design) were analyzed the effects of a gait training program on gait motor variables of a Parkinson's disease patient, based on audio-visuals stimulations.
